alert.note: Alert for Bath; Elliott; Menifee; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morgan, southeastern Bath, northeastern Menifee, southern Rowan and west central Elliott Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cogswell, or 7 miles south of Morehead, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Zilpo around 450 PM EDT. Clearfield around 455 PM EDT. Bangor, Big Woods and Dan around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lick Fork, Crix, Paragon, Pelfrey, Craney, Leisure, Blaze, Blairs Mills, Zag, Hamm, Yocum, Wrigley, Dehart and Kellacey. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 134 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
